steps.step: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.Line an 18 X 13 inch sheet pan with aluminum foil. Scatter the lemon slices on the pan.In a small bowl, mix the lemon juice, grainy mustard and dijon mustard together. Season with salt and pepper and 1 teaspoon of the fresh dill.

Place the salmon on the sheet pan and rub with the mustard sauce. Season with kosher salt and black pepper.Thinly slice the potatoes (I leave the skins on) and place in a bowl with the asparagus and smashed garlic cloves.
Drizzle with the olive oil, season with salt and pepper and toss to coat. Scatter the vegetables on the sheet pan as evenly as possible. Season with more salt and pepper if desired.
Bake the salmon and vegetables for 15-20 minutes or until desired doneness, checking the cook time at the 10-12 minute mark.
Serve with additional mustard sauce if desired and sprinkle with fresh dill and more lemon wedges if you like.

ingredients.original: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

ingredients.original: 1½ pounds small new potatoes (red or white)

steps.step: Begin by mashing the avocados together in a medium bowl, then add the tomatoes, strawberries and peaches.
Mix all of the ingredients together then juice the lemon into the guacamole and add the fresh basil.
Begin by mashing the avocados together in a medium bowl, then add the tomatoes, strawberries and peaches.
Mix all of the ingredients together then juice the lemon into the guacamole and add the fresh basil.
Steam the green pieces until just tender, about 5 - 7 minutes. Allow them to cool slightly.
Add all the ingredients into a mixing bowl and toss to combine.
Serve immediately.

steps.step: In a medium-sized mixing bowl, mash together the blanched peas, ripe avocados, and 1 tablespoon of salsa juice. You can do this with a fork, pastry cutter, or potato masher. If you prefer it creamy, pulse a few times in a food processor.
Add remaining ingredients to the avocado mixture and mix well.

results.title: Pasta with pine nuts, broccoli, sardines & fennel

steps.step: Bring a large pan of water to the boil, with a splash of oil, then add the pasta. Cook following pack instructions, adding the broccoli for the final 5 mins.
Meanwhile, gently heat the oil in a large pan.
Add the onions and sliced garlic, and cook slowly for 2 mins.
Add the fennel and cook for a couple more mins, until softened. Flake the sardines into the pan and stir around for a few more mins to break them up.

Tip the pasta and broccoli into the pan with the pine nuts, raisins and lemon juice. Toss together to let the pasta absorb the oil, season well and serve immediately, scattered with lemon zest and chilli flakes.

ingredients.name: olive oil
ingredients.original: 4 tbsp extra-virgin olive oil, plus 1 tablespoon
ingredients.originalString: 4 tbsp extra-virgin olive oil, plus 1 tablespoon

ingredients.name: long pasta
ingredients.original: 500g bucatini or long pasta, like spaghetti
ingredients.originalString: 500g bucatini or long pasta, like spaghetti
ingredients.originalName: bucatini or long pasta, like spaghetti

ingredients.name: broccoli
ingredients.original: 500g purple sprouting broccoli, stalks halved if very large
ingredients.originalString: 500g purple sprouting broccoli, stalks halved if very large
ingredients.originalName: purple sprouting broccoli, stalks halved if very large

ingredients.name: fennel bulb
ingredients.original: 1 small fennel bulb, very thinly sliced
ingredients.originalString: 1 small fennel bulb, very thinly sliced

ingredients.name: sardine
ingredients.original: 50g salted sardine, or good-quality canned sardines in oil
ingredients.originalString: 50g salted sardine, or good-quality canned sardines in oil
ingredients.originalName: salted sardine, or good-quality canned sardines in oil

Mix well.In a small bowl, add all the dressing ingredients.

Pour dressing over salad and mix until everything is incorporated.Spoon about 1 cup of the mixture onto each tortilla, wrap and serve

Pour dressing over salad and mix until everything is incorporated.Spoon about 1 cup of the mixture onto each tortilla, wrap and serve

steps.step: Mix the marinade ingredients with 2 tsp salt and 1 tsp black pepper. Slash the legs of the chicken a few times, then rub the marinade all over, including under the skin of the breast. Marinate in the fridge for up to 24 hrs.
Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas
Put the onions, lemon halves and ginger in a roasting tin. Sit the chicken on top and roast for 1 hrs or until the thigh juices run clear when tested with a skewer.

When the chicken is done, lift out of the tin, sit in a new dish, cover loosely with foil and leave to rest. Fish out the ginger from the tin and discard. Scrape out the roasted middles from the lemons into a food processor, add the onions and any pan juices, and whizz to a pure. Scrape the pure back into the tin and sit on the hob. Stir in the coconut milk and bubble gently, scraping up any chicken bits that have stuck. You can add a splash of water if the sauce is too thick. Stir in the coriander and serve with the chicken.

results.title: Quinoa Tabbouleh Salad {5 Tips for Effortless Entertaining}

steps.step: Place quinoa through mint in a large bowl and drizzle with lemon juice, olive oil, salt and pepper; toss well.Check for seasoning and adjust accordingly before serving.
